oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Modelling spreadsheets for stable isotope fractionation during diamond crystallization
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Stachel, Thomas
oai_dc:dc.dc:description:
DiaRIF allows to model the effect of Ralyeigh isotope fractionation of carbon and nitrogen isotopes and N-content of diamond during precipitation from a fluid/melt containing a single carbon species.
RIFMS allows to model Ralyeigh isotope fractionation in multi-component systems following Ray and Ramesh (2000). The modelled fluid contains two carbon species. d15N and N-content are calculated as in DiaRIF.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Earth and Environmental Sciences
stable isotope
Rayleigh fractionation
d15N
